nl_problem:
# Task: activity_selection
# Interface:
Class: Solution
Method: maxActivities(self, arg1)

You are given n activities with their start and finish times. Select the maximum number of activities that can be performed by a single person, assuming that a person can only work on a single activity at a time.
Input is a list of pairs `(start, finish)`.

Constraints:
- 1 <= n <= 10^5
- 0 <= start < finish <= 10^9
lisp_spec:
(task
 (name "maxActivities")
 (signature ( (self) (arg1 (list (tuple int int))) ) (list int))
 (constraints
   (constraint "1 <= n <= 10^5")
   (constraint "0 <= start < finish <= 10^9")
 )
 (goal
   (description "Select the maximum number of activities that can be performed by a single person, assuming that a person can only work on a single activity at a time.")
   (rule "Sort activities by finish time and select non-overlapping activities.")
   (return "A list of integers representing the indices of selected activities.")
 )
)
